intro: Metrosideros brevistylis, commonly known as the short-styled flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting birds and insects. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The species is part of the Myrtaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and tea trees.
